column4: lakita: here ya go, this should help, it's how to create swap files in Linux of any flavour, should work http://www.linux.com/feature/113956
I don't really see the difference in sudoing and root access... it's really the same thing and it's annoying to have to type "sudo apt-get" all the time instead of just apt-get
your right, but thats ubuntu's philosophy
he tried but he needs permissions for that (has to be root)
